name.namePart: Printed at Senefelders in Mexico City.

mods.abstract: The scene depicted in the print recalled a visit the artist made to Acapulco, MexicoMsDurieux related that in 1932, Acapulco's beaches were relatively abandoned locationsThe composition strengthens this solitude, which the beaches offered, by the suggestion of the unfrequented beach and the lone vessel in the backgroundThe humor of the print is, of course, presented by the handling of the monumental female figure.
mods.note: The drawing was created with both lithographic pencil and ink.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.)Museum of Art

titleInfo.title: Caroline Wogan Durieux Works of Art
